title: How to Decorate Your Room in the Shabby Chic Style

steps.headline: Pick colours.
steps.description: The best colours for the walls are light pastel colours such as white, light green, pink and blue.

steps.headline: Understand what "shabby chic" is.
steps.description: "Shabby chic" is all about lightly worn linens, laces, and eyelet laces. Try your local second hand store for such items.

steps.headline: Floors can be carpeted (off-white or natural), or for a true old fashioned feel, have floorboards with a pretty floral rug on top.
Have a wrought iron or wooden bedstead, with floral covers and lots of mismatched cushions!
Get furniture.
steps.description: Ask an older relative if you can have old chairs, tables, desks, etc. out of their attic/basement to be painted white or check out the "Shabby Chic" collection at Target.

steps.headline: Get bedspreads.
steps.description: Bedspreads in the shabby chic style are easy to find; either check out the attic/basement, or just search the Internet for "shabby chic bedspreads".

steps.headline: Buy some old antique teddies and china dolls and display them in a rocking chair with lots more cushions!
Buy some floral or striped curtains.
Buy a wrought iron or crystal chandelier and hang it in the middle of the room.
Gingham fabrics also look very effective!
Buy or make some of those sweet hanging fabric hearts, which can be hung on door handles and bedsteads.
Replace the knobs on your wardrobe, dressing table and chest of drawers with other mismatched ones.
Hang puppets and tea light holders from the ceiling.
Hang pictures of flowers and old book illustrations such as Alice In Wonderland and The Secret Garden on the walls.
steps.description: Find posters from Breakfast at Tiffany's or Grease to have an old world feel.

steps.headline: Pick some flowers from your garden and arrange them in a vase.
steps.description: Roses and Honeysuckle are very pretty, as are lavender and lupins.
